questions.text: A 18-year old girl presented to the gynocology OPD with amenorhoea . On examination she was found to have Tranner's Stage V breasts and no pubic and axillary hairs . Ultrasound revealed absent uterus . What is the likely diagnosis
questions.solution: A Ref.: Williams obstetrics 24/p149 Absent uterus with well developed breast could either be mullerian agenesis or AIS. Absence of pubic and axillary hair makes the answer as AIS as in mullerian agenesis the pubic and axillary ahir are normal.

questions.text: A lady underwent vaginal hysterectomy for carcinoma cervix. Following the surgery, after her urethral catheter was removed, she complained of urinary incontinence . On examination she had normal voiding as well as continuous incontinence. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: A Ref.: Shaw's Textbook of gynaecology 15/e p186 History of continuous dribbling with normal voiding tells that the site of fistula is between ureter and vagina. In vesico vaginal fistula there will be continuous dribbling but there will be no voiding as all the urine from the bladder will escape out and there is no collection in the bladder.

questions.text: Which of these is not a support of the uterus
questions.solution: D Ref.: Shaw's Textbook of gynaecology 15 Rectovaginal septumis not a support of uterus. There are four major supports of uterus these are uterosacral ligaments, cardinal ligament, pubocervical ligament and levator ani. The single best answer is cardinal ligaments which are also called mackenrodt ligaments. Uterosacral and cardinal ligaments together also make up level 1 de lancey support.

questions.text: A 10 year old presents with mass involving umbilical region and the hypogastrium. On examination it is cystic and mobile and the examiner is unable to insinuate fingers between the mass and the pelvic bone . What is the likely diagnosis .
questions.solution: D Ref.: Shaw's Textbook of gynaecology 15/e p79,385 It is abdominopelvic mass and the fact that we cannot reach to the llower margin tells us its arising from the pelvis so the answer is ovarian mass.

choices.text: Give IV fluids keep NPO and observe for 4-5 days

questions.text: A young lady with 6 weeks amenorrhea had nausea and vomiting with severe abdominal pain . Her BP was 100/80 mm Hg. Examination revealed a 5*5 cm adnexal mass. What is the plan of management?
questions.solution: B Ref.: Williams obstetrics 24/e p 385 The patient is early pregnancy and has presented with abdominal pain, we would keep ectopic pregnancy as one of the diagnosis. As the patient is stable and we do not have ultrasound as an option here we will do serial HCG along with monitoring to see whether the mass is ectopic or not.

questions.text: A lady with abdominal mass was investigated . On surgery , she was found to have bilateral ovarian masses with smooth surface . On microscopic they revealed mucin secreting cells with signet ring shapes . Diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Signet ring cells are characteristic to krukenbergs tumour which is a secondary to the ovary. Most common primary for it is gastric cancer

choices.text: Two tabelet of high dose OCP repeated after 24 hours

questions.text: A 32 year old P2L2 lady comes five days after unprotected sexual intercourse . What will be your advice for contraception in this lady :
questions.solution: B Ref.: Williams obstetrics 24/e p714 Although all emergency contraceptive drugs are effective upto 5 days but most effective at this time is copper IUD LNG tabs should be ideally used within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse. It can be taken as a single dose of 1.5mg or taken as divided dose of 0.75mg 12 hours apart. Tubectomy is not done as emergency contraception

choices.text: Volume 1.5 ml count 15 milion, morphology 4% progressive motility 32%
Volume 2.0 ml, count 20 milion , morphology 4% progressive motility 32 %
Volume 1.5 ml count 20 milion morphology 4% progressive motility 32%
Volume 2.0ml, count 15 milion morphology 40% progressive motility 32%

questions.text: According to the 2010 WHO criteria what are the characteristics of normal semen analysis
questions.solution: A Ref.: www.who.int/reproductivehealth /topics/infertility/coper_et_al_hru.pdf The lower limit values of semen analysis as given by WHO for conception are the following 1) Volume greater than 1.5ml 2) Total count greater than 39million/ejaculate 3) Sperm concentration greater than 15million/ml 4) Total motility 40% 5) Progressive motility 32% 6) Morphology 4% 7) Vitality 58% 8) WBC count less than 1million/ml

questions.text: Which of the following is not a primary non-contraceptive use of levonorgestrel IUD?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Premenstrual Tension A. Endometriosis: The levonorgestrel IUD is commonly used to treat endometriosis by reducing pain and suppressing the growth of endometrial tissue outside the uterus. This is a well-established non-contraceptive use. B. Premenstrual Tension: While the IUD might have some benefit in alleviating PMS symptoms for some women, it is not a primary non-contraceptive use. Premenstrual Tension (PMS) is generally not a direct or primary indication for IUD use. C. Complex endometrial hyperplasia: The IUD is often used to treat endometrial hyperplasia and prevent its progression, particularly in women with risk factors like obesity or estrogen therapy. This is a non-contraceptive use. D. Uterine bleeding: The IUD is also used to treat abnormal uterine bleeding, another non-contraceptive benefit of the device.

questions.text: A 28- year-old female patient presented with lower abdominal pain along with dysmenorrheal. The following finding was seen on Laparoscopic examination. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: c. Endometriosis The image shows chocolate cyst or endometrioma in the ovary and this is characteristic to endometriosis. The other lesions seen on laparoscopy are powder burnt areas which are old lesions and red flame lesions which are new lesions of endometriosis. The most common site of endometriosis is ovary followed by POD.

choices.text: Can be fertile with ovum donation
Gonadectomy is indicated for all patients

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about pure gonadal dysgenesis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ref: Shaw’s textbook of Gynaecology 15/e p 145 Swyers is a type of pure gonadal dysgenesis, where the karyotype is 46XY with mutation of SRY region and because of this a testes does not develop and gonads become fibrotic streaks. If they want to be pregnant then they will need donor ovum which can be used for IVF. They don’t need surrogate mother as they do have a uterus. Gonadectomy is indicated when there is Y chromosome and pure gonadal dysgenesis there could be karyotype with X chromosome also. So B is a better answer than D

questions.text: Which of these is seen in Asherman syndrome
questions.solution: . b. Hypomenorrhea Ref: Shaw’s textbook of Gynaecology 15/e p 250 Due to damage to the endometrium in ashermans syndrome by development of fibrotic adhesions, the most common presentation is menstrual irregularities. Among menstrual irregularities the most common complaint is amenorrhoea followed by hypomenorrhoea. The most common cause of ashermans is vigorous curettage and the risk is highest if the curettage is done for PPH.

questions.text: HSG image below shows
questions.solution: a. Endometrial polyp Ref: Shaw’s textbook of Gynaecology 15/e p 103 Fibroid, polyp and adhesions all produce filling defect in hsg. The polyp defect is smooth and I the center of the cavity. Fibroid will also have smooth mrgins but is close to the wall. While the adhesions of ashermans will produce filling defects which are multiple small and have irregular margins

questions.text: What is the most likely cause for beaded appearance of fallopian tubes with clubbed ends of fimbriae on HSG?
questions.solution: a. Genital Tuberculosis Ref: Shaw’s textbookofGynaecology 15/e p 111 The beaded tubes on hsg with golf club appearance is characteristic of genital tuberculosis. The other appearance of genital tb on hsg are tobacco pouch, lead pipe and hydrosalpinx

questions.text: All of these can be used for postcoital contraception except
questions.solution: a. Desogestrol Ref: Williams obstetrics 24/e p 714 Desogestrel is not used as emergency contraceptive, its levonorgestrel which is used as emergency contraceptive. High dose oral contraceptive pills can be taken as divided dose for emergency contracetive. Copper t can also be used as emergency contraceptive. Most effective emergency contraceptive is copper t and most effective hormonal emergency contraceptive is ulipristal.

questions.text: Which of these is diagnostic of premature menopause?
questions.solution: a Serum FSH > 40 Ref: Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology 15/e p 62 Premature menopause is defines as menopause in a woman less than 40 years of age and it is confirmed by serum FSH levels which are more than or equal to 40IU on 2 occasions 1 month apart. These women will also have low e2 and low inhibin.

questions.text: A G3 p2, pregnant comes to your clinic at 18 weeks of gestation for genetic counseling. She has a history of two kids born with thalassemia major. Which test would you recommend now?
questions.solution: A amniocentesis woman needs antenatal testing and at 18 weeks it is best done by amniocentesis. Amniocentesis can be done anytime after 15 weeks and is most commonly done at 16-18 weeks. The cells that are used for diagnosis are the amniocytes and dermal fibroblast. Amniocentesis is diagnostic and the safest method. Ref: Williams obstetrics 24/e p 300

questions.text: What is the first sign of puberty in a girl?
questions.solution: a) Thelarche Ref: Ghai essential pediatrics 8/e p 531-535 The first sign of puberty is growth spurt although the first visible sign of puberty is thelarche. This is followed by pubarche then peak height velocity then menarche. The average age of puberty is 10.5 years and age for precocious puberty is if it happens at less than 8 years

questions.text: Ulipristal acetate is a/an:
questions.solution: d. Selctive progesterone receptor modulator Ref: Harrison’s principles of Internal medicine 19/e p 2391 Ulipristal is an emergency contraception and is a selective progesterone receptor modulator The dose is 30mg single dose and is effective upto 5 days of unprotected intercourse. The other progesterone receptor modulator used as emergency contraceptive is mifepristone in a dose of 10-50mg.

questions.text: A mother brings her19-year old daughter to your clinic with complaint that she has not started having menses.general examination reveal normally developed breast and pubic hair on pelvic examination .vaginal ending is blind and uterus is not palpable. Which of the following do you suspect:
questions.solution: A Mullerian agenesis A Ref: Shaw’stextbookofgynaecology15/ep145 Williamsobstetrics24/ep149 Absent uterus with well developed breast and pubic hair are markers of mullerian agenesis. Discussed above

choices.text: Observation and follow up for cyst after2-3months

questions.text: A 26 year old female presented with mild pain in lower abdomen. She has had 2 full term normal delivery earlier. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks back. On pelvic examination you find a palpable mass in the adnexa on pelvic examination you find a palpable mass in the adnexa. On USG pelvis you find a 5cm ovarian cyst. What should be your next step:
questions.solution: A Observation and followup for cyst after2-3months Ref:Shaw’sTextbookofGynaecology15/e pg369 The cyst is most likely the corpus luteum of pregnancy and needs no intervention. These cyst spontaneously regress at 12 weeks hence we will follow up with repeat usg after 12 weeks.

questions.text: A 25- year old female comes to your clinic for evaluation of infertility. A hysterosalpingogram reveals Asherman’s syndrome. What symptom will the patient have :
questions.solution: A Hypomenorrhea Ref: Shaw’stextbookofGynaecology15/ep250 Discussed above Due to damage to the endometrium in ashermans syndrome by development of fibrotic adhesions, the most common presentation is menstrual irregularities. Among menstrual irregularities the most common complaint is amenorrhoea followed by hypomenorrhoea. The most common cause of ashermans is vigorous curettage and the risk is highest if the curettage is done for PPH.

questions.text: A 45yr old patient presented with complaints of pain in abdomen and menorhagia. Endometrial biopsy was normal and sonogram of uterus showed and diffusely enalarged uterus with no adnexal mass. Whatis thediagnosis:
questions.solution: A Adenomyosis Ref: Shaw’sTextbookofgynaecology15/epg 475 ADENOMYOSIS • Symmetrically enlarged globular uterus, tender • Complaints: dysmenorrhoes, dyspareunia • IOC: MRI • First investigation : USG • Confirmed by HPE • Uterus doesn’t grow beyond 10 to 12 weeks size

questions.text: The following is the picture of the papsmear of a 45year old female with left ovarian tumor in her late menstrual phase showing squamous cells. What is the likely histology of the tumor:
questions.solution: A Granulosa cell tumor Ref: Shaw’s textbook ofgynaecology15/epg379 Since the smear shows plenty of superficial cells, which predominate in the presence of estrogen. So we must think of estrogen secreting tumour and hence the answer is granulosa cell tumour.

choices.text: Pap smear should be repeated yearly in women of reproductive age group
HPV test should be done five yearly in women between age of 30 to 65 years
VIA/VILI is more reliable at older age as it becomes easier to identify the transformation zone with age
Pap smear can be repeated less frequently if it comes out negative for 3 consecutive years

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about cervical cancer screening guidelines according to WHO?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) -Start Pap smear at 21 years of age -----> Repeat every 3 years -----> Till woman becomes 29 years of age -----> From 30-65 years of age A) Pap smear + HPV DNA testing ( Co-test) every 5years ( Best) B) Continue Pap smear every 3 years. -Stop Pap smear at 65 years Criteria to stop: A) 2 Co-test/ 3 pap test : Normal consecutively for Past 10 years B) Hysterectomy done for a benign course - HIV positive female : Annual screening . Uncertain to stop screening at 65 years. - If a female has taken HPV vaccine ---> Continue screening as usual.

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presents with an adnexal mas. CA-125 is slightly raised, CA-19-9 is normal and LDH is elevated. Tumor was resected and the gross and microscopic image were as given below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Dysgerminoma Ref: Shaw 15/e pg 378, Robbins 8/e pg 1049 The characteristic cut surface of dysgerminoma is solid lobulated and pale or tan. Also the given tumour markers which is raised LDH and slighty raised CA125 tell us that this is dysgerminoma.

questions.text: A patient presenting with an adnexal mass was operated and the following tumor was removed. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: a. Mature teratoma Ref: Shaw 15/e pg 377, Robbins 8.e pg 478 This is the image of a dermoid and presence of tooth and hair are the key things to identify. The other name for dermoid is mature cystic teratoma. It is the most common germ cell tumour of ovary and also the most common ovarian tumour in the reproductive age group and pregnancy

questions.text: What is the drug of choice for precocious puberty in girls?
questions.solution: a. GnRH analogues Ref: Shaw 15/e pg 56 The treatment of precocious puberty is GnRH agonist to be given in a continuous pattern. Precocious puberty is more common in girls and the age criteria is development of secondary sexual characters before 8 years of age.

questions.text: A young female presents to you with primary amenorrhea. Examination reveals normal breast development and absent axillary hairs. Pelvic examination shows a normally developed vagina with clitromegaly. On ultrasound, gonads are visible in the inguinal region. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: b. Partial androgen insenstitivity syndrome Ref: Willams Obstetrics 24th edition pg 149: Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology 15/e pg 145 Primary amenorrhoea with normal breast development and absent pubic and axillary hair with gonads in inguinal region is very characteristic to androgen insensitivity syndrome and because the question says clitoromegaly then it is partial AIS because in complete AIS the clitoris is hypoplaastic

questions.text: A 32-Years-old female came for routine PAP smear testing. The report came as carcinoma in situ. What is the next step?
questions.solution: (a) Colposcopy and biopsy Ref. ASCCP guidelines. PAP smear is a screening test and hence abnormal reports have to be confirmed and once it is HSIL or carcinoma in situ then doing colposcopic directed biopsy is mandatory amd should be combined with endocervical curettage

questions.text: Sperm analysis report of a young man is as follows - Count of 25 million, volume 1.5ml, motility 15, morphology 15. Your most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: B Normal values • Total motility >40% • Progressive motility >32% Asthenospermia is a condition in which there is low motility of the sperm .

questions.text: Which of the following test is useful to test the motility and morphology of sperm?
questions.solution: B Sims huhner test is the other name for post coital test. It is used to test for anti sperm antibodies (ASA). It is done between day 12 to day 14. If ASA is positive, then the management is intrauterine insemination.

questions.text: Which of the following is a risk factor for ectopic pregnancy
questions.solution: D Most important risk factor for ectopic pregnancy • After 1 previous – risk is 15% • After 2 previous – risk is around 30% Current use of IUD will increase the ectopic if there is failure of contraception Infertility and assisted reproductive techniques may produce heterotropic pregnancy

questions.text: Uterine myoma can derive it's blood supply from
questions.solution: A Uterine artery is a branch of anterior divison of internal iliac arteyr

questions.text: Uterine myoma can derive it's blood supply from
questions.solution: A Uterine artery is a branch of anterior divison of internal iliac arteyr

questions.text: A patient present with history of primary amennrohea and polydactyl. On examination she was found to have vaginal atresia and had polydactlyl and echo showed suggested TOF. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: D MURCS: mullerian duct aplasia, renal dysplasia, cervical somite anomalies It is nothing but MRKH type 2.

choices.text: LASER method has less complications rate than the conventional method
Unprotected sexual intercourse allowed after 1 confirmed negative semen analysis report

questions.text: True regarding vasectomy is/are? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: C,D,E Explanation: Options A and B are incorrect. There is no risk of testicular cancer. Failure rate is variable and is average 0.1%. Other options are correct

questions.text: Indications of Moskowitz repair include? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: D Explanation: Enterocele is a hernia of the lining of the peritoneal cavity with or without abdominal viscera. The enterocele can occur posteriorly with or without inversion of the vagina. The Moschcowitz procedure is performed by placing concentric purse-string sutures around the cul-de-sac to include the posterior vaginal wall, the right pelvic side wall, the serosa of the sigmoid, and the left pelvic side wall. The initial suture is placed at the base of the cul-de-sac. Usually, three or four sutures completely obliterate the cul-de-sac.

choices.text: Carneous degeneration may occur in pregnancy
May not increase in size in pregnancy
1% cases may undergo sarcomatous change due to pregnancy
Broad ligament fibroid are small and can lead to menstrual irregularity in non-pregnant females
Hydroureter is mostly caused by anterior wall intramural fibroid

questions.text: True regarding fibroid in pregnancy? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A,B Explanation: Option A is correct. Carneous degeneration is a subtype of haemorrhagic infarction of leiomyomas that often occurs during pregnancy. On gross pathology, it is characterised by a red (haemorrhagic) appearance of the leiomyoma. Red degeneration primarily occurs secondary to venous thrombosis within the periphery of the tumour or rupture of intratumoral arteries Option B is correct. Majority of fibroids do not increase in size during pregnancy Option C is incorrect. Option D is incorrect. They are large and not associated with menstrual irregularities Option E is incorrect.

questions.text: Which among the following is/are causes of primary amenorrhea? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A,B,C,D Explanation: Sheehan syndrome is secondary amenorrhea cause. Other options are correct.

choices.text: Suppression of tonic inhibitory effect of dopamine on prolactin

questions.text: Hyperprolactinemia may be associated with? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A,B,C Explanation: Sheehan syndrome can cause paradoxical hyperprolactinemia

questions.text: After prophylactic bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy in genetic risk of ovarian cancer, what is the chance of occurrence of malignancy? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A Explanation: BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutation carriers have an 18%–60% and 11%–27% lifetime risk of developing ovarian carcinoma, respectively. Prophylactic bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy reduces the risk of this malignancy by up to 96%. Thus the risk of malignancy is only 4%

choices.text: Loop of > 2 cm excises a bigger cone
Can be done only in cervix

questions.text: True regarding LLETZ procedure? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: AB Explanation: A LLETZ is a procedure to remove cervical tissue for examination and to treat some precancerous changes of the cervix.A thin wire loop heated by an electrical current is used like a scalpel to remove the abnormal tissue from the transformation zone of the cervix. Can be done in 7-10 min and is less costly. LASER is more costly and takes longer time but preferred in large lesions.

questions.text: Clinical case of abnormal uterine bleeding comes. Management of endometrial hyperplasia without atypia shall include? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A,C,D Explanation: Management of simple endometrial hyperplasia without atypia includes Identify and manage risk factors like obesity Progestins are the first line therapy The LNG-IUS should be the first-line medical treatment because compared with oral progestogens it has a higher disease regression rate with a more favourable bleeding profile and it is associated with fewer adverse effects. Continuous progestogens should be used (medroxyprogesterone 10–20 mg/day or norethisterone 10–15 mg/day) for women who decline the LNG-IUS. Cyclical progestogens should not be used because they are less effective in inducing regression of endometrial hyperplasia without atypia compared with continuous oral progestogens orthe LNG-IUS Treatment with oral progestogens or the LNG-IUS should be for a minimum of 6 months in order to induce histological regression of endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. If adverse effects are tolerable and fertility is not desired, women should be encouraged to retain the LNG-IUS for up to 5 years as this reduces the risk ofrelapse, especially if it alleviates abnormal uterine bleeding symptoms.

questions.text: Not a criteria to define PCOD? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: B,C,D Explanation: PCOD criteria

questions.text: Stage 3 cervical cancer involves? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: B, D stage 3 cervical cancer is divided into 3A: involves lower 1/3rd of vagina 3B: upto pelvic wall or having evidence of hydro ureter 3C1: positive pelvic lymph nodes 3C2: positive paraaortic lymph nodes Best way of asses lymphnodes is CT PET or ct guided biopsy.

questions.text: Which among the following is/are consistent with histology of type 2 endometrial cancer? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A,B,C,E Type 1 are endometroid type of cancers involves grade 1 and grade 2 histology. Risk factors include obesity. Type 2 are clear cell , serous, papillary, mucinous types and involve grade 3 histological types. They are less common, non estogen dependent and have poor prognosis. Genes associated are p53. Treatment involves pelvic lymphadenectomy.

questions.text: Complete mole chromosomal finding is/are? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: B,C 80% are 46XX and monospeemic 20% are 46 XY and dispermic Complete mole is easily identified on USG as it produces snowstorm appearance. Theca lutein cyst is found and there is no fetal tissue. Complete mole has a high risk of conversion to neoplasia. GTN 15 to 20% Choriocarcinoma 4%

choices.text: Increased cervical mucus amount and thickening
Preventing sperm movement to appropriate site

questions.text: Which among the following is/are the mechanism(s) of action of DMPA? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A,C,D,E DMPA is an intramuscular injection. It contains 150mg of drug medroxy progesterone acetate given every 3 months once. Mechanism of action of DMPA include Inhibition of ovulation ( main mechanism of action) Increased cervical mucus thickening to make it impermeable for sperms Endometrial thinning Decrese tubal motility hence prevent fertilisation Advantages of DPMA are, it can be used in women with epilepsy and women with sickle cell anemia. Diadvantages of it are : delay in return of fertilisation with average delay being 12 months and decreased bone mass

questions.text: HSIL is seen on PAP smear in a female on work-up. The next line of management will include? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: A, B Next step after abnormal pap smear would be colposcopy directed biopsy. In cases of HSIL we also add endocervical curettage

choices.text: More in Caucasians as compared to Asians
Rotterdam criteria decreases the possibility of diagnosis
Difference in incidence explained by different criteria used in different countries
Variability of hirsutism in females of different areas may make the diagnosis difficult

questions.text: True regarding PCOS and its epidemiology is/are? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: B, D, E Incidence in Chinese females is 5.6% Different incidents are found in different places because we use different defining criteria Rotterdam criteria increses the possibility of diagnosis as presence of two criteria itself is sufficient for diagnosis

choices.text: Postpartum endometrial curettage may be responsible
Hysterogram can be done for the diagnosis

questions.text: True about asherman syndrome is/are? (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: B,C Post partum endometrial curettage has high risk of causing asherman syndrome Hysterogram shows irregular filling defects . it is used as screening test and not for diagnosis Diagnostic test is hysteroscopy LH and FSH is normal. E+P challenge test and P challenge tests are negative

questions.text: All of the following is true about low dose progesterone except?
questions.solution: A Mechanism of action of low dose progesterone are Increased cervical mucus thickening to make it impermeable for sperms Endometrial thinning Decrese tubal motility hence prevent fertilisation

questions.text: A 30 years-old women visited the doctor with the complaint of infertility, following test was done showing given abnormality, what is the diagnosis-
questions.solution: A

questions.text: A women presented with abnormal vaginal bleeding. A gross section of her uterus given is shown below diagnosis is-.
questions.solution: A Uterine fibroid Smooth muscle tumour Age >35 yrs Primary complaint : menorrhagia Irregular groth Non tenser Grows upto 20wk size Investigation of choice ultrasound

questions.text: Anteversion of uterus is maintained by?
questions.solution: A There are four major supports of uterus these are uterosacral ligaments, cardinal ligament, pubocervical ligament and levator ani. a. Level I: uterosacral + cardinal ligaments b. levelI: paravaginal tissues and their attachements c. level II: perineal body and its muscles

choices.text: 46 XY and 46 XY with testes and ovaries and gynaecomastia

questions.text: Testiovo syndrome (previously called as true hermaphrodite) is characterized by:
questions.solution: B Testi-ovo syndrome has functional elements of both testis and ovary. It can be in the form on ovary one one side and testis on the other or in the form of ovotestes. Biopsy from which will reveal tissue of ovary and testis. In true hermoprhoidtes the most common karyotype is XX, they can also show XY/Mosaic pattern. They have both male and femal einetrnal and external genitalia.

questions.text: In congenital adrenal hyperplasia what is seen?
questions.solution: D In congenital adrenal hyperplasia the genotype is XX but the esternal genitalia may be virilised. New born child born with clitoromegaly. This is the most common cause of female pseudohermophrodite. Most common cause of male psueodohermophrodite is AIS

questions.text: All of the following is seen in chronic PID except?
questions.solution: A Pyometra is an acute presentation of PID. Most common cause of PID in general is endometrial CA. Most common cause of pyometra in india is CA cervix

questions.text: Most common sequelae of chronic PID?
questions.solution: B PID Most common complication is infertility Gold standard investigation is diagnostic laparotomy Other investigations : USG and endometrial biopsy Most common organism : chlamydia>gonorrhoea

choices.text: Two or more ova in same cycle from separate act of coitus
Two or more ova different cycle
Two or more ova same act of coitus

questions.text: Superfecundation is fertilisation of:
questions.solution: A Superfecundation is fertilisation of two or more ova in same cycle from separate act of coitus Superfetation is fertilization of two or more ova in different menstrual cycles

questions.text: Calculate the pearl index of the contraceptive if out of 20 women, 8 got pregnant in 24 months?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Pearl Index is defined as the number of contraceptive failures per 100 woman-years of exposure (HWY). -Pearl index = Total accidental pregnancies x 1200/Total months of exposure. Here, the total number of accidental pregnancies are 8. Pearl's index = 8*1200/24 = 400 HWY

questions.text: Mullerian Inhibiting substance gene is located in which chromosome?
questions.solution: A MULLERIAN INHIBITING SUBSTANCE Gene located on chromosome 19 Released by sertoli cells as early as 7 weeks of intrauterine life Causes disappearance of ipsilateral mullerian duct

questions.text: All are advantage of hysteroscopic over open myomectomy except-
questions.solution: C MYOMECTOMY abdominal myomectomy laparoscopic myomectomy: slightly increased recurrence risk hysteroscopic myomectomy: used for submucosal type o and 1 fibroids

questions.text: Gestational trophoblastic neoplasms does not include
questions.solution: D • Gestational trophoblastic neoplasms include a. Choriocarcinoma b. Placental site trophoblastic tumour c. Invasive mole d. Epitheloid trophoblastic tumour (ETT) • m/c GTN is invasive mole followed by choriocarcinoma • least common is ETT

questions.text: 45 year old female with 3 months of menorrhagia. USG showing 2 cm fibroid. What is the treatment of choice?
questions.solution: C Any woman > /= 45 yrs of age and has abnormal uterine bleeding should undergo endometrial sampling to rule out endometrial malignancy

questions.text: In low ovarian reserve, the anti Mullerian hormone levels will be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Anti mullerian hormones Secreted from small antral and pre-antral follicles In poor ovarian reserve AMH will be <0.5ng

questions.text: 30 yr old women with complaints of dysmennorea, dyspareunia with chronic pelvic pain undergoes hysterectomy. From the cut section of hysterectomy specimen below, identify the diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) ADENOMYOSIS Symmetrically enlarged globular uterus, tender Complaints: dysmenorrhoes, dyspareunia IOC: MRI First investigation : USG Confirmed by HPE Uterus doesn’t grow beyond 10 to 12 weeks size

choices.text: Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair

questions.text: 60 yr old woman comes with 3rd degree uterine prolapse. What will be the management?
questions.solution: A Ward mayo surgery : vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair Pelvic floor repair includes surgery for cystocoele ie anterior colporrhaphy and surgery for rectocoele ir posterior colpo-perineorraphy

questions.text: Day 20 of menstrual cycle comes under which Phase?
questions.solution: D Leuteal phase is fixed. Lasts for 14 days. Begins with the onset of LH surge. It shows secretory changes in the endometrium

questions.text: Partial hydatiform mole is associated with chromosome number?
questions.solution: D Partial hydatiform mole is 90% of the times tripoid. The extra set of chromosomes are paternal. They are dispermic. Complete moles are diploid 80% of times. They are monospermic.

questions.text: Vaginal atrophy and itching are treated by ?
questions.solution: A Vaginal atrophy is given lubricants followed by local administration of estrogen creams It is not an indication to start HRT

questions.text: Greenish frothy vaginal discharge is produced by ?
questions.solution: C TRICHOMONAS VAGINALIS pH: more than 4.5 discharge, pruritis, urinary complaints, dyspareunia saline microscopy shows organisms ratio of PMN: epithelial cell - >1 best investigation: culture ( stuart’s media)

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to OCP usage?
questions.solution: B Estrogen is a pro-coagulant which is present in OCP. Therefore people with history of DVT, stroke, venous thrombo-embolism and cornoray artery disease should not be given OCPs. Known or suspected pregnancy becomes a contraindication rather than mrere history of amenorrhoea.

questions.text: Hormone predominantly secreted after 14th day of menstrual cycle is
questions.solution: A Secretory phase seen after 14th day. Hormone responsible is progesterone. 1st histopathological evidence of progesterone secretion is subnucleolar vacuolation.other histopathological findings are corkscrew glands and maximum stromal edema
